pros: There is great team work among employees within each unit. From an employee perspective, the focus is on good outcomes and patient care.
cons: The Baptist company does not seem to cherish its greatest asset- the employees (particularly the nurses).  Not doing this portrays a lack of compassion to the patients, poor patient safety focus, and causes patient care to be in serious jeopardy.

pros: Great co workers and terrible ICU!!! Too many young nurses that don't have a clue as to what is going on with their patients!  No team work, always on their cell phones instead of patient care

job_title: Laboratory Technician Assistant in New Albany, MS

review_title: A great place to start your nursing career.
job_title: Emergency Department RN in Southaven, MS
pros: The people who work here are the best you will ever meet. So warm and kind and always willing to teach and help. Management has been willing to listen to concerns and implement new ideas.
cons: Low pay. Always focusing on times and numbers. Constantly adding to our workload. No holiday pay

pros: PTO accrual, great co-workers, training and additional education/certification opportunities. Also good benefits package available.
cons: Benefits package is not as great as it was due to budget cuts. I was told that they are no longer offering loan payback program or NCLEX bonus to new employees.
